title: Michael Staziker
text:
Michael William Staziker (born 7 November 1947) is a former English <a href="cricket">cricket</a>er. He was a right-handed batsman and a right-arm medium-fast bowler who played for <a href="Lancashire%20County%20Cricket%20Club">Lancashire</a>. He was born in <a href="Croston">Croston</a>, near <a href="Chorley">Chorley</a>, <a href="Lancashire">Lancashire</a>.
Staziker had represented the Lancashire Second XI in the Minor Counties Championship and the Second XI Championship since 1966; his first-team cricket was restricted to the month of June 1970 when he appeared in one limited-overs and two first-class games. He later played as a professional for <a href="Lancaster%20Cricket%20Club">Lancaster</a> in the <a href="Northern%20Premier%20Cricket%20League">Northern League</a>.
